website_summaries.verdict: Offers good reception, but may not be the best model for users who want a paper-thin design.
pros: A trusted brand with a reputation for quality
Durable design produces clear reception in almost any room
Amplifier can be used to access more channels
cons: It's bulky compared to other models
The six-foot cable is not long enough for some users

customer_reviews.title: ... moved it around quite a bit to get the best signal. It really needs to come with a ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to moved it around quite a bit to get the best signal. It really needs to come with a longer cable. I had to get an adapter and extend the cable to get it to my window. And suction cups to mount on a window would be nice. But once I was able to find suction cups and mount it to the window, I was really surprised by the number of channels that I was able to get. And I live in a low area with a lot of tall trees around.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy F.

customer_reviews.title: It worked!!!
customer_reviews.text: ...bought this in 2010 and it's been sitting in my garage since then. I decided to give it a try with my 40" flat screen Sony TV and it worked. I was able to get 35 very good quality channels...I've been monitoring it for the past seven days and it consistently performed flawlessly. I live on a hilly area and naturally, there are channels with weak signals that I am unable to get but I am happy with the 35 that I am getting. I am now contemplating on doing away with my very expensive cable subscription soon.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel T. Pineda

customer_reviews.title: Easy to plug and play.
customer_reviews.text: I read the negative reviews and it convinced me that this would be the antenna for me. I was right. They complained they were getting 20ish channels. Before this antenna, I got ABC and the religious channels in the area on a rabbit ears. I tried the $75 paper thin antenna and got PBS. The RCA antenna, I am getting 26 channels including everything local channel except for FOX and it is digital. I am in a low lying area surrounded by a forest. Oh, and the religious channels are not included in the channel count as they are not digital. So very happy.
customer_reviews.author: GabrielMyCat

customer_reviews.title: Best HD Antenna.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 previous HD antennas and none of them compare this HD antenna so far. I previously bought 2 Mohu HD antennas, another brand from Best Buy, and although there was descent reception on most channels, Channel 5, 7, and 9 would come in blurry and channel 9 was so bad that you had to reposition the antenna every time we wanted to watch that channel and would still come in a little fuzzy. The RCA ANT1650F Antenna does not have that issue. No repositioning needed, and it is not too bulky, and the images are crystal clear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just hooked up the unit and I finally have TV in the bedroom. I did not want to pay the cable company any more money than the outrageous fees I am paying. The reason I did not give this 5 stars are the instructions. I have a Samsung tv that was set up for cable. I had to go into the system and change the setting from cable to air. After that, I ran scan and the channels were keyed in. If the setting is not change from cable to air, the antenna will not work. Air is the setting for my tv. I was hoping to receive more channels but some are far better than none!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: lakesidegent

customer_reviews.title: They Lie.
customer_reviews.text: I am so so so mad. Twice I sent back these stupid antenna. The keep sending me an antenna that is so thin and flat like a piece of paper that is is made with plastic. I wanted the thicker plain plastic rca antenna that hangs on the wall. AND IT DOES NOT REQUIRE DOWNLOADING CRAP ON A COMPUTER OR PHONE!!!!!. They lie. You never get what the item is in the photo. Now I have to send this one back to. It's a waste of time gas money effort ect.
customer_reviews.author: Kitarra

customer_reviews.title: Like any indoor antenna
customer_reviews.text: These RCA antennas rock. I have tried all kinds of indoor antennas, but none compare to the RCA with booster. I live in the city and have no obstructions so I can pick up well over 100 channels. Like any indoor antenna, it can get fussy on cloudy/rainy days. Fortunately we don't get many of those in southern Cali. If you want to be a cord cutter and save a ton of money, I suggest you consider this one. I have several of these and plan to get another for another room.
customer_reviews.author: coast rider

customer_reviews.title: Location, location, location
customer_reviews.text: Just know that this antenna will work based solely on location. I lived in one place and it picked up 42 channels. That is because I was basically at the top of a mountain on the top floor of a building with a direct line to the station that emitted channels. I moved about 2 hours south of that area and it didn't pick up anything, not even one channel. Use antennaweb (dot) org to find out which channels you can pick up in your area before you buy this. This got the overall best ratings by Consumer Reports, but like my review states, the ability of an antenna to function depends more on your location than anything.
customer_reviews.author: Careful shopper

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work For me
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this antenna because it got good reviews and consumer reports recommended it. The problem is, I live in a somewhat rural area and it did not work for me. After receiving it and trying to get it to work, I consulted their website where I was asked to enter my zip code. When I did that, I was told that in my area the only type of antenna that would work was one that was mounted on my roof. I feel the website which is [...] should be included in the description so purchasers can make an informed decision as to whether this will really work for them.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Surman

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Installs in minutes.  Really good value
customer_reviews.text: Works great! And much sleeker design than old fashioned rabbit ears. I have it on my window sill, leaning upright. But you can also lay it flat, if you are in a good reception area. If you have a smart TV, you can plug it directly into the TV. If you have a not-smart TV you still need a digital converter box (sold separately). Installs in minutes. Fool proof. And great product for its price. I use this to pick up all the local channels. And have Amazon Prime and Netflix for movies. I don't have a need for cable.
customer_reviews.author: baloo

customer_reviews.title: Cut the CABLE and save hundreds of dollars!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best little gadgets I have bought in a long time! I decided a couple years ago to cut the cable and go with on-line streaming, but I missed getting local weather and news channels and broadcasts... so I added a Digital Antennae to the TV. This inexpensive little antennae picks up a lot of channels and with the optional booster, can even work in markets where there aren't a bunch of broadcasts available! I had to play around with the placement of my antennae and whether or not to include the optional booster... but I have about 25 channels that come in clearly. I am very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: SunnySouthTexas

customer_reviews.title: Picture for product not same as received
customer_reviews.text: If you see the photo above, it looks like the antenna is made of some sort of glass, but when received, it’s just made of some hard plastic. Very deceiving. Product is bad quality. I bought one for $9.99 on my local store and it works better than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works so much better than those paper thin POS antennas that you see ...
customer_reviews.text: Works so much better than those paper thin POS antennas that you see out there. Yeah, I'm looking at you Sobetter 50 Mile Range Indoor TV Antenna! You were a joke! This antenna is significantly better. It's not going to be as good as one of those TRUE Omni-directional antennas, but it's still really good. I pick up about 20+ channels. I'm in a hillier part of Portland, Or
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You'll laugh, you'll cry, you'll kiss the cable company good-bye!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cut the cable company out of your life. I cancelled my direct TV subscription and purchased this digital antenna and now get HD TV, and also use Netflix and Apple TV. Never going back to cable. I tried other antennas and they didn't work, but this one is great. I just hooked it into the coax that was used by my cable service and I power 2 TVs in my house. As reference, I live in North Scottsdale AZ, and the TV station transmitters are about 20-25 miles south of me in Phoenix and Mesa, so I have the antenna pointed south.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Casey

customer_reviews.title: OK, but not as good as the 1750F
customer_reviews.text: Works OK for most channels, but not as good as older model 1750F. I have the 1750F and receive all local channels very well. With this new 1650F (with the amplifier), a couple of the channels kept dropping out. Or, the picture would stay, but the sound would drop for a second. It did this about once per every couple minutes. It's a pretty good antenna. If you live very close to the signal, maybe it'll work for you.
customer_reviews.author: EverLearning

customer_reviews.title: A LOT TO BE DESIRED
customer_reviews.text: RCA ANT1650F/ANT1650R Flat Digital Amplified Indoor TV Antenna The most dependable station is 15 miles away. I can get that one with simple Rabbit Ears however. The next two are 31 and 32 miles distant. I get those OK if I do a little adjusting of the orientation of the antenna and full amplification. The two stations that are 34 miles and 40 miles really iffy. The rest, PBS at 33 and 36 miles, and those beyond 40 miles -- nothing. That is consistent with the assessment of Consumer Reports. They suggest buying it locally as store with a generous return policy. Good advice. I plan to keep mine even though it is not the wonder product described.
customer_reviews.author: rcyoungs

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Living in the country there is no cable and I refuse to pay for satellite tv. We previously purchased these before after some research and were very pleased with the reception we got. We got this one to hook up to another tv in the house. We get over 30 different channels and it’s all free other than what we payed for the antenna.
customer_reviews.author: RiddleL

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna
customer_reviews.text: Decent reception in my area of town (Houston, TX near med center/NRG stadium). I noticed a difference in reception (better, stronger) and channel noise (much less) when this antenna is propped up using the including stand versus laying flat. As such, I have my propped up on the floor facing out my balcony window. With the amplifier, I was able to receive several channels than I normally wouldn't have; however, much of them I deleted as the content was unappealing to me (and I don't watch much television as it is). Nevertheless, I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Useful—finally!
customer_reviews.text: This is an updated version of the same RCA antenna I’ve had for several years. The surface of the antenna has changed from shiny to matte. They have added a useful free app from RCA that you can download to assist with positioning the antenna. I had to work for days before finding a position that allows me to bring in my local PBS channels. Once I got that right, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Mira

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding! 3X more channels, lost only 1 over cable
customer_reviews.text: I only use cable to get my local channels. With this antenna I get all of them and gained ALL the alternates (3X the number of channels) and lost only 1. I can live with that. I'm about 20-30 miles from the nearest antenna and everything looks great. Everything is sharp, crisp, and clear. But... There's always a but. At night when stations lower signal output, or if it's stormy, this unit has issues. Not its fault. If you want basic VHF (It's not all that good on UHF.) then I still highly recommend this unit. Seriously. If you're happy with a half dozen channels and their alternates, then go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Z

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Amazing reception, easy installation
customer_reviews.text: Forget Comcast. Every time I turn around Comcast is changing channel lineups, adding channels, removing channels, etc... All I wanted was the basic free channels that come over the airwaves for my two secondary TV's in the bedrooms, but thanks to Comcast scrambling even free channels, I had to look for an alternative. This low profile antenna picked up 40 free channels broadcasting in the Chicago area. Crisp, clear HD channels. No converter box needed since both TV's are digital. I'm even considering canceling Comcast for my main TV since we just have the basic channel lineup anyway and watch a lot of TV over the Internet and Netflix.
customer_reviews.author: J. Storer

customer_reviews.title: Finally, An Antenna That Works.
customer_reviews.text: I've been through several antennas, and really don't understand why I can see my city's transmission towers five miles away, but can't get many of my national HD channels. This antenna was given great reviews, and I agree completely. I'm glad that I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Waterboy

customer_reviews.title: cheap easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a extra room just for the tv to have some service, gets most local channels. works as expected. I have it just sitting next to tv on dresser not at window or outside. just looking for a easy clean setup, not looking for rabbet ears. Yes I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: but it seems that it picks up best when the cable wire coming out of of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I went from 6 digital channels to 12 and there were still 3 analog as before. .... I put it up on my inside window ledge kinda flat against the window glass with a slight angle to lean against it to keep it in place..... but it seems that it picks up best when the cable wire coming out of of the square antenna is on the bottom that is what got me the most channels .....it easily pulled in channels from a town 60 miles away. Very Sharp Picture! There is a metal leg stand that I didn't use due to the window shade catching on it. But no problem using it without that
customer_reviews.author: luckyscmuk

customer_reviews.title: Performed worse than the Amazon Basics flat antenna
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to see if it would be an improvement over the Amazon basics flat antenna's that were good but in my area (NE of Tampa - New Tampa area) we are 23 miles from the towers and I could get all of the majors except ABC is always breaking up with the flat antenna's I am using. This one supposedly had a higher range than the flat ones but actually performed worse in the exact same positions. I returned it and have purchased an antenna to mount outside to see if that will fix the ABC issue. Not a huge deal as with ABC we can see the shows the next day on Hulu Plus anyway!
customer_reviews.author: GreenThumb

customer_reviews.title: Needs more work
customer_reviews.text: The concept is good, but it does not work unless you have access to a tower regardless of the range of 50 miles. We are within a 10 mile radius and were able to receive 4 channels - none of them local. Yes, the disclaimer should be heeded. This would be best for a city setting because reception of the signal would be stronger. Research your area before purchasing any indoor antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Silver and Young

customer_reviews.title: Review of the RCA ANT1650F Flat Digital TV Antenna
customer_reviews.text: I unpacked my knew RCA ANT1650F Flat Digital Amplified TV Antenna and did an auto channel scan and I was able to receive PBS, NBC, WLFT, FOX, the Daystar Network, METV, ZUUS, SSN and two weather channels. I then connected the supplied amplifier to the antenna and received the same channels. I then connected an additional 36 db TV signal amplifier and was able to receive ABC and CBS in addition to the other TV channels. This TV antenna really works very, very well! I give it stars! For best results Position Your antenna near the window and as higi as possible and you'll have great success.
customer_reviews.author: The Royal Prince

customer_reviews.title: Did not work indoors, needs precise direction
customer_reviews.text: When it was outdoors and pointed in exactly the right direction, the picture quality was exceptional. However, this is an indoor antenna, AND, I need this antenna to point in 2 different directions to get the channels I want. So it turned out to be pretty much useless.
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes requires repositioning but picks up all my local channels
customer_reviews.text: In my bedroom. Picks up local channels just fine. Depending on the channel might have to position this a little differently. I used the kickstand and set it up on a shelf. Depending where I'm standing in the room it might get intermittent (darn digital television, whatever happened to the good ol' analog days where low signal meant you could still watch your show? This newfangled 'digital' stuff, when it gets a low signal, it cuts out. Bummer). Just rotate or reposition as necessary for that channel, kick back. I have not tried it without the powered amplifier.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Had an $8.00 set of digital "rabbit ear" type of antenna before. The reception was not great so I thought I would try the ANT-1650. Found that the reception was only slightly better than the $8.00 rabbit ears and spent $30.00 more. I also spent 30 minutes trying to find a place that the "Patented design specifically for 360 degree digital TV reception" would pick up anything. Had to finally add an extra 8 feet of cable in addition to what came with it and hang it at the ceiling in a closet. My TV did detect an additional 8 channels but 6 of those had no reception. My advice don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jay Smith

customer_reviews.title: Gets great reception for QVC
customer_reviews.text: Cannot receive any PBS station despite several being within 20 miles of my home. Gets great reception for QVC. Also doesn't get very good reception for local broadcast stations. When I contacted support I was told to move the antenna a few inches and run my TV's auto program function over and over until I (hopefully) got what I was looking for, namely any PBS station. No success and I live in the middle of my town.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Briggs

customer_reviews.title: RCA Amplified HDTV Antenna is a keeper.
customer_reviews.text: The RCA HDTV Antenna is already working better than the Mohu model I purchased from a different vendor, shame on me. I still need to find the ideal spot to permanently place the antenna. Although the product literature states the antenna has a patented omni-directional capability, it also states to find the optimal location for permanent placement. I've been so busy watching the fantastic high definition reception from the antenna that I haven't taken the time to ascertain the optimum spot for permanent placement. Thanks once again Amazon for such prompt delivery and courteous service.
customer_reviews.author: Danny E Sieg

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Got this after we decided to forgo cable. It's okay...it just depends where you place it. I can't seem to get it to pick up more two clear channels unless I place it in the window on its side. It really matters how far you live from big city towers. But it's a good deal for the price, and it's a lot better than the rabbit ears I had before this that may or may not have been murdered by my cat.
customer_reviews.author: R. Meza-MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: I get a great signal with this!
customer_reviews.text: And its saving me $50 a month which I was paying to Charter. I don't need all the channels but maybe some people do and I don't know how satisfied they would be with this product if this is the case. I just want to watch PBS and the morning news and its wonderful for this - I get about 10 channels in an area which has very poor signal. Well worth paying just the refurbished price. I bought one from a store for full price and then added this one from Amazon for less than half what I paid for the new one. This one works exactly the same!
customer_reviews.author: Trudi Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: I had 2 of these. I liked them at first. But both stopped working for no apparent reason. I've checked all the connections. They just don't send a signal anymore.
customer_reviews.author: NOLA User

customer_reviews.title: Never RCA again
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the bunnyears. All major networks come in nice and strong. *13 month update* The item no longer works which is a bummer. 1 month past the 1 year warranty. All the channels quit coming in or had spotty reception. I believe the amplifier quit working since turning the power on and off made no difference. Anyone recommend a replacement? I bought an RCA 1275F from a brick and mortar since I needed a replacement that same day, it worked fine until this past month, lasted a whopping 3 months. No more RCA for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jac

customer_reviews.title: I get an 89 mile range facing window
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best antenna yet. It says 50 miles , but according to my map of broadcast stations, its 90 for me. Sometimes have to fiddle with the cord to get all the channels, but it is so worth it 130 free channels so far.
customer_reviews.author: Susanswerphone

customer_reviews.title: RCA ANT1650F Flat Digital Amplified Indoor TV Antenna
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when I bought this antenna, having no idea about anything other than cable TV. One can pretty much pay anything from $10 to $150 for a digital antenna. I read Amazon reviews and decided that for the money, this item seemed to be the best. I was not wrong. I literately plugged it into my flat screen and wall outlet, changed the input to “air”, and auto-searched for channels. That was it! That simple. For the intended use, it works perfectly! I even have channels that my cable service does not offer.
customer_reviews.author: Espana

customer_reviews.title: 20 year old rabbit ear antenna still gets better reception
customer_reviews.text: I wondered if this might get stronger signals than the Radio Shack rabbit ear antenna I've used for 20 years. IT DOESN'T !! I thought the amplification might allow signal reception from all directions but it wasn't so. Bad weather, wind, or sun shining on the screen also caused about half of the 23 channels I receive to be intermittent or unavailable at times. I went back to the old rabbit ears that can at least be redirected and adjusted to receive the best signals possible. This antenna may work well in some areas but, in my case anyway, the old rabbit ears works as well or better.
customer_reviews.author: TennisMikeyJ

customer_reviews.title: No need for an amplified version, base version works just as well.
customer_reviews.text: I also own the RCA ANT1600 without amplifier. I was having trouble getting some channels with it however and couldn't get ABC at all. So I bought this amplified one to see if it would make any difference. It didn't. I still can't get ABC and the channels I had difficulty with are still troublesome. Don't waste your money getting an amplified antenna unless you are in the boonies. I live in Los Angeles proper and am about 17 miles from the antennas. An amp won't help.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied with this Antenna's Quality
customer_reviews.text: I was initially thinking about getting the Winegard Flatwave Antenna, but after I saw how thin and flimsy that thing was, I thought I should go with a more well known brand (RCA) and an antenna that's actually a solid piece. Setup was easy. It says you have to first screw in the coaxial cable into the amplifier first, then into the TV, and lastly plug in the amplifier (if you want). I got many HD and non-HD channels as soon as I hooked it up. This I was very pleased with. However, I cannot get channel 6 ABC. I've noticed alot of other people can't either. Very strange. Anyways, this is a great product, and I do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Rez

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Indoor Antenna
customer_reviews.text: Most products are overhyped, this one is accurate and even slightly conservative. We had found with the 30-40mi radius to pull in maybe 10-12 channels/sub-channels. Instead after scanning we got about 21, so after eliminating (skipping) 3-4 spanish speaking channels we get 17 and sometimes 18-19 when it pulls in occasional fringe stations. Small aiming adjustments help if a station is misbehaving (pixelization) but thus far I am pleasantly suprised with the power of this Indoor Antenna. I'd give it 5 stars if it had been a little more powerful so we wouldn't have to occasionally redirect it.
customer_reviews.author: S. White

customer_reviews.title: It's an antenna
customer_reviews.text: Typical antenna. Ordinary RF amp... Very cheap coax and F connectors.. Probably reflects the rest of the internal components selection and quality.. Remember digital signals either work or they don't. Unlike the old analog signal where quality and strength did make a noticeable difference. With digital you just have to capture it. Quality after that point is the same.
customer_reviews.author: LEO EXECUTIVE

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect too much!
customer_reviews.text: This antenna looks good and was super easy to set up. I got ready to watch my favorite game show on the local Fox channel and discovered I can't find it because it is broadcast on VHF. This antenna also can't seem to pull in the local CBS channel. It has picked up around 20 digital UHF channels though and the reception on them is actually better than my cable service, which I'm hoping to ditch in the near future. But I need an antenna that can bring in VHF channels, and clearly this isn't it. Before you consider this antenna, check the channels you want to watch and if any of them are VHF, don't buy this!
customer_reviews.author: K. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: needs more power
customer_reviews.text: I can pick up stations within 40 to 50 Miles. The three I wanted are around 60 miles away and I receive none of them :( This is advertised as superior strength Antenna for indoors It looks like I may just need an outdoor antenna for that extra 10 miles. The amplifier really helps the signal strength on the farther away channels I do get. I have the antenna in a window about 40 feet off the ground, surrounded mostly by hills though. If your on the fence between a indoor or outdoor antenna for farther away channels I'd suggest something else. I Would have given five stars if I could just get that extra 10 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Build quality "meh". Amplified?
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised pretty much. I don't know about the whole "Amplified" claim. It gets about the same number of channels as we got with our previous antenna that wasn't "amplified." That being said, it was pretty much dirt cheap, and it works, and has the convenience of laying flat or being wall-mounted. I def like the slim design. Much less obtrusive than other models that have to stand up to work. The build quality seems a tad bit uncertain. Feels like it could break easily, but so far it hasn't. Granting that it continues working, it was a great buy for it's design and affordability. GET IT!
customer_reviews.author: thedudeabides

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: We cancelled cable and use the internet to watch most content on Netflix or Amazon Prime. We still watch some network programs and a lot of PBS. We live between 15 and 20 miles from the local broadcast towers. This antenna is outstanding. No need to adjust. Hangs on the wall like a picture. Simple. We previously had amplified rabbit ears. What a pain. Constantly adjusting depending on the channel selected. With the flat antenna, we get every local station crystal clear. The only times there is a bit of interference or signal drops is when the weather is awful - high winds or drenching rain. This is rare.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Works great in the city!
customer_reviews.text: This amplified antenna pulls in much more channels in Manhattan NYC than my other RCA non-amplified antenna (ANT-121) with the rabbit ears. Just plugged in the coax to my HDTV antenna coax, did an auto scan. Some channels still get some static interference here and there but my TV set definitely shows a stronger signal strength for all channels (my HDTV displays the signal strength). Antenna is placed near the window. Disconnecting the amplifier you definitely notice a difference - some channels have a weaker signal coming through. Picture quality is amazing. Very happy with this upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: RNYCS

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive antenna
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this antenna four months ago to use in my camping trailer. It works very well. When the camper is in the driveway I get almost as many stations as in the house. The house uses a huge rooftop antenna with a rotor and power booster. This little omni-directional antenna is only a couple stations behind the rooftop antenna. In the camper it is mounted on a wall vertically for convenience and space saving. The antenna booster operates on 12v DC. I am able to have the antenna wired directly to the camper's 12v system rather than using the supplied 120v AC adapter.
customer_reviews.author: beemerphile1

customer_reviews.title: I love this antenna
customer_reviews.text: I love this antenna. Although I bought it to get one specific channel that Directv stopped carrying it turns out I can't get that channel with this antenna due to where our apt. is located, I did however find out that when I open my window and stick the antenna outside I get the channel I was looking for. Even though I won't be using it outside when it's very cold or raining, so I can't get my channel, I have found several other channels that I love. I also like the fact that when it rains and my satellite goes out I can still get the network channels, this was great during the World Series, GO METS!
customer_reviews.author: yomousey

customer_reviews.title: It was a great disappointment. But again
customer_reviews.text: I give this only three stars but I must admit it could be our house and location and not the antenna. We were only able to receive three channels and tried it in two different rooms in our house. It was a great disappointment. But again, we have plaster walls and live in town, could that be our issue? If you purchase this item, i hope you have better luck and are able to get out of the cable rat race!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with Product
customer_reviews.text: Item was a little larger physically than expected, but not to the point that it was distracting. Like other reviews i found stronger signal strength when it was laying flat, but connected to more signals when hanging on the wall. No wall mounting "bracket" but item did come with two wall screws that the Antenna slides on and latches so wall hanging is possible right out of the box. Overall Great Item, and more than satisfied with the purchase. **UPDATE** I originally hung this antenna on the wall, but found that the 360 degree capabilities work best when the antenna is free standing with the provided stand attachment. I now get all stations with nearly full signal strength.
customer_reviews.author: SuperSonicSloth

customer_reviews.title: works great, I don't miss cable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after I returned a cheaper antenna. The cheap antenna gave me six channels, this gives me 23! Sometimes I have to adjust the position (like rabbit ears) but I believe that's due to my location relative to the local antennas, If you live in an area where you can get away with an indoor antenna then this is the way to go. My picture is every bit as good as it was on cable.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Works for me in Brooklyn NYC
customer_reviews.text: I decided to ditch cable for the new year and save some cash. I just received this item today. I hung it up on my wall, I live in brick building on the first floor in the Gowanus neighborhood in Brooklyn. I can get 40+ stations, some of which are in Spanish and other languages. ABC does not come in well on this antenna, this is likely because ABC is broadcast on a VHF band and from what I've read it is difficult to get that signal because of tall buildings and reflection of signal. I'll be experimenting to see if I can get a better signal. CBS, NBC, and FOX come in just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for over the air channels
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good unit. We are able to get several channels with it and the signal quality is good. I had an outdoor HDTV antenna at my last house that actually had a few more channels, but I didn't watch them anyway and the signal quality is the same. The only problem I have with this unit is that it picks up interference from other electronics if it is too close. For example, if my PS3 is turned on and this is within 6 inches, the channels get skippy. Not a real big deal, because I can't really watch TV and use the PS3 at the same time...
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Keller

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set-up but have not been able to get any TV stations. I live in a suburb of a major city and it amazes me the local stations do not come in. Wondering if it is because the instructions say to turn the TV to antenna. My TV has only TV and CATV. Will keep working with it to see if I can get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Who knew how many random channels are available over the air? Once you use this antenna, you'll be able to see the broadcast staples (CBS, NBC, ABC, FOX, PBS) plus a slew of other channels (depending on your location). I'm in Northeast Phoenix (bordering North Scottsdale) and I get many crystal clear channels (including, CBS, NBC, ABC, FOX, PBS, Channel 3 - Arizona TV, ION, many Spanish language channels, many religious channels, and several others). This was incredibly easy to install and worked immediately. My parents couldn't believe the quality picture without cable. Now, my dad is ordering one.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: We get channels and they are pretty clear, but we lose them at times.
customer_reviews.text: Going from no channels to 13 to 20 is pretty great. Some of the channels are duplicates, and some are not really clear, but the large networks (cbs, nbc, abc, fox) are all clear. The amplifier did help us get more channels. My only complaint so far is that a few of the channels aren't picked up anymore even though we haven't moved the receiver. But overall, we are happy with it. Since we aren't big tv watchers anyway, it's nice getting the networks we do and not having to pay for a tv subscription.
customer_reviews.author: NicksterTheTrickster

customer_reviews.title: Better reception, more free HDTV channels!
customer_reviews.text: Works better than our previous owned RCA ANT1450 Flat Digital Amplified Indoor TV Antenna as it is bigger. We can now receive more over the air HD channels, and signals received are stronger too. Used to be that we'll need to adjust the RCA ANT1450 position (flipping it over onto the other side and used the included easel stand to raise one end higher) from time to time when some stations' HD signals occasionally weaken (HD signals are not as forgiven as analog signals). There is no need for such adjustment any more as it is RCA's top-of-the-line product. Their Reception Quality Rating is listed on the box so one can compare.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: we are pleased. My hesitation on a better review is that ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, we are pleased. My hesitation on a better review is that we cannot catch one of our local stations that the RCA website said we should be able to receive with this antenna. Not sure if it's the antenna or station. It's a bigger square than I'd expected, so not "compact" if it's visible, regardless of how slim it is. However, if you're mounting behind a flat screen, you'll never know it's there.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Falling short
customer_reviews.text: Once we hooked this puppy up...... it didn't make any improvement. We actually got better reception with the rabbit ears we use currently. I can only assume the very rural area we live in, and all the trees affect this products function. It would be great if they posted on their description that it works best in city or suburban areas, if, indeed, that is the case. Didn't work at all for us.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This antenna is very poor quality. I bought a Amazon antenna that was cheaper and does a better job of bringing in stations than this product. In fact this product did not bring in any of the 12 stations the cheaper antenna did, it only brought in 1. Since this product claims to have a amplifier I tried to place my better, cheaper antenna on the connection to the amplifier thinking maybe I could save myself the trouble of sending it back, but the amplifier too is inferior. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Tami Gardner

customer_reviews.title: I recommend checking antennaweb
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work well for me. Only pulled in seven stations. I moved it close to a window and it pulled in one or two more but some of them kept freezing. Apparently I am in a "red zone" according to the CEA and probably need an outdoor multidimensional antenna. I recommend checking antennaweb.org to see what zone you are in (based on how far away you are from the towers and whether there are hills and trees in the way) and what kind of antenna your place will need.
customer_reviews.author: Spelly

customer_reviews.title: About to order my 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with the Elgato tV One to watch TV on my Mac, set up took a few minutes, to scan for digital content, and once it was finished the quality was... nothing short of amazing! Granted, there weren't a 110+ channels to choose from, but for the basic network channels, and a few oddball local, it's a huge savings over cable, dish or otherwise. I'm in Manhattan wedged between a lot of hi rises, and yet not an issue, so far. The channels came in exactly the same with or without the amp, so I opted not to use it. Now I'm going to buy one for the living room TV.
customer_reviews.author: George Stoll

customer_reviews.title: RCA CANT1650F Flat Digital Amplified Indoor TV Antenna
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised, and better. We are approximately 25 miles from our local TV station's broadcast towers and this antenna receives the signals perfectly (as well as a number of channels I have no idea where they are coming from). The HDTV channels have a perfect picture on our big screen TV. I have the antenna mounted up in the attic with a splitter hooked up to it so it can be received on two TV's, which also works perfectly. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: I have 3 of these!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful antenna! I get lots of channels.....love it! It worked so well for me is the reason why I purchased 2 more.
customer_reviews.author: Mavis

customer_reviews.title: HD Antenna (Indoor)
customer_reviews.text: I can neither recommend or not recommend this product. The product itself did not work due to my location. Surrounded by 80 ft trees and on the backside of a hill from all of my local tv towers. I am in a hilly region of my state. I have lots of experience with antenna's and electronics. I thought I would give it a shot just to see if I could get a signal and I could not. I will need an external antenna more than likely. Trying to find alternative to cable tv. I will try an external directional HD antenna next.
customer_reviews.author: drunkenbrewmaster

customer_reviews.title: Great for an extra or if you don't won
customer_reviews.text: Great for an extra or if you don't won.t to pay a lot of money for cable, it does what you need. Works great.. My area doesn't give a lot of channels, but 13 is enough to get what I want. NOT a flood of NEWS channels about some depressing turn of things. Just basic, but that is enough for imformation and entertainment. Works fine.
customer_reviews.author: write girl

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised
customer_reviews.text: RCA ANT 1650R - It arrived at my door 30 seconds after I confirmed the order, well not really, but it seemed like it. I installed as directed, w/amplifier, in 2nd floor bedroom. I activated the auto-channel on my LG TV/Monitor. In about 15 minutes the TV had located 14 channels. That is 10 more "local" channels than my Cable provider (ATT) will provide for $35 per month. Half of the new channels are not info-mercials. Yes, this product worked well for me. I do need to add, I am within 10 miles of a medium metro area and in the flat low country of South Carolina. Enjoy the day,
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Just OK - Not what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.text: If you're expecting a vast improvement over non-powered antenna, don't get your hopes up. I still get lots of drops and frozen digital signal with this unit. Overall it is an improvement, but it didn't solve the problem of a signal that often cuts in and out. I realize that it may just be my area and/or set up, but I did follow all the setup instructions carefully. Perhaps there's just a limit to what these types of antenna can do. Other than the signal issues, the product is solid. Good construction and ample instructions.
customer_reviews.author: LA DIY

customer_reviews.title: Might work, might not.
customer_reviews.text: If this worked, and worked well, it would be great. It only works some, and poorly, so I can't recommend it - even though I live in a large city and everything is close by... And, it's true, older rabbit-ear-and-a-wire loops work about as well. Sadly, both require "twisting and turning" depending on what station you want next. We went back to our attic style antennae, which is over kill and more work than I wanted to do. But, I only had to set it up once. This thing you have to keep moving around - and then it still disappoints.
customer_reviews.author: Woodlandsman

customer_reviews.title: nice looking product
customer_reviews.text: Slim, nice looking product, but it did nothing to satisfy our needs. We picked up lots of PBS-type channels, but did not receive any of the standard stations - ABC, CBS, NBC or Fox. However, two (2) friends are using the same product to have something to watch late at night or to just keep them company. Another friend has put one in a gust room for when her young granddaughter sleeps as the simple device receives lots of educational cartoons
customer_reviews.author: FayBem

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced another HD antenna which I was constantly adjusting to obtain a passable signal, with this model. I decided not to add the amplifier unless I needed it. The RCA ANT 1650F was hung on an interior wall maybe 12 feet from the nearest outside window. Since the day I attached it to my TV I have had zero issues. It picks up all the local channels without the need for the amplifier or any adjustment. In short, it works as advertised, at least in my house.
customer_reviews.author: P.F.

customer_reviews.title: Very Bad
customer_reviews.text: The antenna is directional? If I point it south at the mountain peak where all the transmitters are it only picks up half the channels. I have selected a direction that is about 20 degrees to the left? If I played around maybe I could pick up more,but I have to rerun channel search at each direction. I am happy with this direction, as it brings in all the local channels I want. I emailed the contractor for some help, but to date I have gotten no response? It is smaller than my rabbit ears and to date I don't half to reorient it to pick up the next channel?
customer_reviews.author: Very Bad

customer_reviews.title: As Functional As Expected
customer_reviews.text: It's an amplified indoor antenna. Given the restrictions of the product type, there's only so much it can do to provide signal. I get every local channel available to me in clear weather, and miss out on two or three of the furthest-away in cloudy and stormy weather. Windstorms, strangely, also kill reception. The device must be placed, on its own, with nothing on top of it, as is standard for an antenna. There's nothing outstanding here, but there's also no reason to pass this over.
customer_reviews.author: James Moore

customer_reviews.title: Check Signal Strength Maps and get at least 2 levels up
customer_reviews.text: According to the maps, my location was about 35-40 miles from the major broadcast antennas. This unit claimed to be good for 50 miles. I was excited that it caught all the major channels in the Metro NYC area (ABC was the weakest). Even more excited that the channels were PERFECTLY clear. However, every 5 seconds or so, image and sound would freeze for a second or so, kick back in, freeze, kick in, etc. Every channel. So, for my location, either have to get an external antenna, or something more powerful. Trying to resist paying for a cable box for broadcast tv.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, but inconsistent.
customer_reviews.text: Got rid of satellite TV. I get all of my favorite TV shows with a Roku, but wanted to get local stations too so I bought this product. It definitely didn't work in the TV alcove, so I moved my TV to a location closer to the window/door as recommended by other reviews. Picked up 22 channels including some I never heard of! The amplifier doesn't seem to make any difference. What does matter is where/how you position it. I finally found the "sweet spot" and hung it on the wall. Sometimes NBC goes in and out, but other than that, I'm pretty happy.
customer_reviews.author: wbrenda312

customer_reviews.title: Adequate but not stellar
customer_reviews.text: Context: 30 miles from towers in Chicago; All within a fairly tight angle to antenna. Tried to place unit in attic, but amplifier is too weak to transmit to the distribution point (total run about 45 feet). So not useful for multiple televisions. After placing unit next to a single television, was able (after trying 3 different positions) to get most of the broadcast stations. However, unit was unable to get channel 2.1, 5.1, and 5.2. Unfortunately, 2 and 5 are the CBS and NBC affiliates in Chicago, so that is a major drawback. Perfect hindsight, I would have been better off spending an additional $50 or so and getting an attic-mounted antenna with a stronger amplifier.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Y

customer_reviews.title: RCA ANT-1650
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the hope of getting rid of my local channels via my satellite provider. I live about 16 miles north of Boston (no idea where all of the transmitters are). After playing with the location of the antenna for a while, I found a good spot on the wall behind the TV where I received very good (100% on a lot of channels) reception without the amplifier. There is sometime some pixelation on a few channels (I assume those transmitters are further away) but overall the reception is very good. I can now cancel my local channels and save the $5.99 / month - the unit will pay for itself in a few months!
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: RCA 1650R Digital Ant
customer_reviews.text: 1) Easy set up. a. Connect the cable to your TV b. Try positioning the Antenna for best reception(Horizontal worked best for me). Note: Don't be shy about trying different positions or elevations. 2) I have not found it necessary to use the amplifier to receive 19 local stations in Hi-Def with little or no drop out. 3) Amazon's price was the best! I have tried other more expensive Digital outdoor antennas, and on a one to one basses this antenna is comparable from the same "indoor" location.
customer_reviews.author: SteveWA_Rvw

customer_reviews.title: RCA Ant. 1650
customer_reviews.text: Great antenna from RCA. Easy to set up ,I said goodbye to sattelite, Why pay for stations when you can get for free over the air. Picture on HD channels is perfect. Better than HD on Sattelite. Recieves all local channels easily.I made flat antenna into a picture frame and it looks great, can't even tell it is an antenna. Great value for the money.I love it and am buying another one for other TV's. Also I connected it to 2 TV's and both work perfect, I just connected it to existing Sattelite cables. Paid for itself in 1 month. Now NO MORE BILLS from DISH.
customer_reviews.author: biker boy 66

customer_reviews.title: Leaf works much better than this RCA
customer_reviews.text: We thought this might be better than the Amazon leaf HD indoor antenna, we were wroooong. Either this one was faulty or it just doesn't work. We have the leaf antenna, 25 miles, and it picks up really well but I wanted to get a specific channel, so I tried this antenna. I tried this on two TVs and with both this antenna and the leaf. The RCA was intermittent and picked up much less signal than the leaf. Immediately returning do the same day. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: RCA ANT1650- Great antenna
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this antenna. I can get about 20 channels pretty clear, just like watching from cable TV. Attractive not ugly like rabbit ears. Can be hidden behind TV and one big plus no monthly cost to watch TV. Lets hope the cable companies do not decide to stop air broadcast of digital TV. Its in the talk make sure you vote or voice your opinion if this happens in your state. The only one issue I had with antenna TV is that it can get pix-elated if a vehicle or something interrupts the path of the signal which is not very often, usually only for several seconds or so.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J

customer_reviews.title: Happy & Saving Money!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product! I grew tired of paying my hard-earned money for satellite t.v. It was the first thing I slashed when the economic downturn hit. Lol :) I am so pleased to report that this antenna has doubled the number of channels I receive! The picture is clear and vibrant. I do recommend varying the position and placement to find which provides the best results for you. I plan to order a couple more of these antennas for televisions in other rooms of the house. The look is sleek and modern.
customer_reviews.author: Atlangel

customer_reviews.title: Good...but very selective on VHF
customer_reviews.text: The antenna doesn't pick up VHF channels well at all. I am using it with the amplifier, but it is still not able to pick up several VHF channels that are well within my range. Channel/OTA antenna guides show I should be able to pretty much receive these channels with the antenna in a lead lined box. I have tried it in several locations, in the attic, on second floor sitting right in the windows, etc...nothing. I feel like I could have done better with an old wire hanger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and pulled in more than enough stations to satisfy my requirements
customer_reviews.text: Works well in my location, even though most of our stations are close to the limits specified for reception. I just set it up on top of a wall unit near a window and didn't "mess" with it at all, and pulled in more than enough stations to satisfy my requirements.
customer_reviews.author: Harold McFarland

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome design. By being able to lay it flat, it goes right under our TV on the entertainment center and you never even know it's there. It works as advertised. The channels it receives look just as sharp or sharper than cable or our Roku. Now that we dropped cable and are only using the Roku, this allows me to watch football! We don't even use the amplifier. I plugged it in and really saw no difference in the reception. If you're on the edge of pulling in a distant signal, it might help though.
customer_reviews.author: lawnmower man

customer_reviews.title: Location is very important
customer_reviews.text: Only works if you have a direct line of sight to the TV stations' antennas. Will not work if you have any large obstruction to that view, no hills, mountains, buildings, etc. Also, a picture is totally dependent on that issue and signal strength. There is no snowy or fuzzy picture. It either works or doesn't work. We are 30 miles south of Philly and hooked it up to a late model digital TV. After channel scanning we didn't get one channel. We have a big hill in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Newbie DIYer

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This antenna is quite good. It is sleek and blends into a stack of coffee table books easily. It's quite low profile. I live in Seattle (98117) and am impressed with the reception I receive. It does help to have it near a window. When I take it away from the window the reception diminishes a bit. Updated 9/14: I recently bought a second one of these antennae for our other TV. I looked at others, but this one still seemed like the best value, and our first one, which we bought over three years ago, is still running strong.
customer_reviews.author: owsinsomnia

customer_reviews.title: More channels than Expected!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great choice!. I dropped Direct TV for a seldom used bedroom TV and installed this small and yet powerful flat antenna. I positioned it in several places to get the most channels and found many I didn't know about. The only one I couldn't get was NBC. Slight negative was the cord is black ( noticeable on a white baseboard) and a bit short. I added a white six ft coax with a connector with no degradation of the signal. The supplied amplifier was essential to our situation.
customer_reviews.author: granpere

customer_reviews.title: All in all this a good receiver.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I hung it on an outside wall. I have only one station about 30 miles away that I can't pickup. I checked online at a website that shows TV stations and antennas required. That station was listed as a medium uni-directional antenna while all others were listed as a small omni-directional antenna. So I assume that is the issue. All in all this a good receiver.
customer_reviews.author: EddieP50

customer_reviews.title: Positive results
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many other antennas from department stores and have always delt with jumpy signals everytime a car drove by. The rca antenna picks up a stronger signal and found more channels but still had some brief losses. My solution was to use a splitter and keep the flat cheap model as well. Big advantage now. Most signals are 75% or better and no more losses. Minneapolis, Minnesota, 2nd floor apartment facing south. 55 channels 2.1 thru 43.7
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for my dad
customer_reviews.text: He says he gets 4 or 5 Spanish channels and all but one local channel plus a bunch more. He counted 38 channels total. That's awesome! This replaced an antenna setup that was nowhere near as good, and he likes the flat design. I give it a 4 because it didn't work so well where I live where we tried to set it up for my mom. My dad does live on the 2nd floor at his place, so maybe that's why it's worked so well. I'm just glad it exceeded his expectations so I didn't have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: keep it simple

customer_reviews.title: Improves reception for some stations
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because we moved into a house where we don't have cable and our TV is slightly below ground level. Our existing RCA non-amplified antenna would pick up most stations if we elevated it, but the signal wasn't consistent. Adding this amplified version cleaned up the signal on a number of stations, and we have almost no issues with them now. Unfortunately, we lost another station that we had been getting altogether. Overall, if you have some issues with TV signal, it's worth a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Rob R.

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Being a long time cable subscriber, I was hesitant about downsizing and getting an antenna, particularly since I live in the south, surrounded by trees which can hinder the signal. But I need not have worried because this antenna works like a charm. The set up was easy and once I stuck it in the window, the signal came through very clear.
customer_reviews.author: Rita S

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Not that great I have rabbit antenna digital it plugs in also doesnt have this amplified box Radio Shack in my living room and it picks up more channels than this. With this I can't pick up CBS or NBC but at least the rest of channels are very clear, I live in Chicago's lakefront lots of tall buildings i'm on 2nd floor that could possibly be the problem maybe if I was higher up... might have to go back to Cable tv so darn expensive tho..
customer_reviews.author: MariaYFamilia

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy unless you live under the tower.
customer_reviews.text: Sucks. I pick up about as many channels with no antenna as when I hooked this up. A 20$ chinese antenna we have picks up 3 times the channels at 20.00. This was 57$. Thought I was upgrading but reality got less.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish It Had Worked
customer_reviews.text: I bought this digital antenna with the hopes of receiving hi-def television stations through the air so that I could drop my expensive-yet-satisfying Fios TV service. Unfortunately, while many of the reviews I read of this flat antenna must have lived in areas with decent reception, apparently I live too far from a major city (30 miles) and in an area of too many hills and valleys. I received NO channels with this product, so I had to return it. I guess I should have figured that if my cell phone signal is so horrendous at my home, a TV signal would be just as bad.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Brown

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well and pulls in signals that another antenna (rated for 40 miles) could not. Before I only received 3 channels with a set of rabbit-ears (and 4 with the previously mentioned directional antenna) but now I receive 10 with very good clarity/signal. Overall very happy with this item. As an additional tip--the antenna works even better if you add a long section of Co-Ax cable between it and the TV (I had to do this for permanent installation to reach from a window to my TV).
customer_reviews.author: Nick Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup & Great reception for price
customer_reviews.text: It works great for the cost. This antenna was very easy to set up. I bought this antenna for a tv in my room that does not have access to cable. Can be fickle with extreme stormy weather, but for the most part I have HD quality reception and can pick up more channels than with my previous antenna. The trick is to find the right spot in the room to get the best reception. But when you find it, you're all set and you get really good quality picture and sound.
customer_reviews.author: Shaell Rodriguez De Cruz

product_meta.title: RCA ANT1650F Flat Digital Amplified Indoor TV Antenna
product_meta.description:
Paintable RCA digital flat indoor antennas No longer does superior reception for your home theater system mean having to compromise the aesthetic appeal of your living room.; In addition to their sleek design, RCA digital flat antennas are paintable. Simply match any color you like, in a non-metallic paint, to go along with your home palette and watch this state-of-the-art antenna disappear into its surroundings. It's just one more way RCA antennas deliver convenient and practical solutions. Customer service : 1-800-645-4994 Email: VACInternational@voxxintl.com

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


SET YOUR TV FREE WITH THE RCA ANT1650 DIGITAL FLAT ANTENNA
PATENTED 360º DESIGN OUTPERFORMS TRADITIONAL ANTENNAS
Dress-up your entertainment room with the sleek RCA ANT1650 piano black digital flat antenna. You'll enjoy enhanced reception with the included, removable amplifier which preserves signal purity with extremely low noise circuitry while amplifying weak signals. Obtain true versatility using the included easel stand. The easel props the antenna up so it can stand alone, opening more possibilities on where to place the antenna in your home. RCA Digital flat antennas are designed specifically for digital TV signals, which require more precise directional reception than analog signals to give you consistent performance. Digital TV provides crystal-clear digital picture and sound, but to get uninterrupted reception your antenna needs to be aimed in exactly the right direction. RCA's unique and patented antenna designs eliminate the guess work in digital reception, finding and delivering great digital picture and sound without the hassle of manual adjustments. Use the included removable amplifier to enhance reception by amplifying weak signals. It helps preserve signal purity with extremely low noise circuitry.

Slim Profile disappears into surroundings

Coax Cable built in

360º of Reception means no missed signal

Paintable Surface blends antenna into any surrounding

TOP FOUR REASONS TO PURCHASE AN ANTENNA
 1. Simply put. The best HD is in the air!
 2. Get free HD. And more free channels too.
 3. Even cable and satellite users deserve the best quality.
 4. Say good-bye to adjusting old rabbit ears, 360-degree reception delivers the best signal.

RECEIVES LOCAL HD AND ALL DIGITAL TV BROADCASTS
SUPPORTS 1080 RESOLUTION RECEPTION
RECEIVE RECEPTION REGARDLESS WHERE THE ANTENNA IS PLACED
PAINTABLE RCA DIGITAL FLAT INDOOR ANTENNAS
No longer does superior reception for your home theater system mean having to compromise the aesthetic appeal of your living room.; In addition to their sleek design, RCA digital flat antennas are paintable. Simply match any color you like to go along with your home palette and watch this state-of-the-art antenna disappear into its surroundings. It's just one more way RCA antennas deliver convenient and practical solutions.

All of RCA's digital flat 
antennas have a unique
design that eliminates
constant adjustments.

Simply hang it, lay it flat or stand it up!

WHAT'S IN THE BOX:
Digital flat antenna, removable amplifier, and built-in

FIND THE RIGHT ANTENNA FOR YOUR AREA
Digital TV signals require better reception than analog TV signals to provide satisfactory performance (i.e. a watchable picture). If you used to get a snowy (but watchable) picture on your analog TV channels, you may find that your new digital channels do not have strong enough signals to display in this new format. Whether you live in the trees, on the plains, or in the midst of hills, make sure you find the right antenna for your individual needs.
